intro: Dasycalyx zeyheri, commonly known as the Zeyher's bush, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage. The plant produces small, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively uncommon in cultivation.
